text: Hi, I have found out that the limitation was caused not by HubSpot but from the 3rd party API rate limit which I was using during File upload.
However I didn't know that there is a hidden folder for attached files. Is it possible to see in HubSpot?

*Edit: Was able to solve this. See solution in comments.*

Hi, I have been stuck on this since Friday and would really appreciate some help!

I am trying to use marketing events with my app. I am able to create the marketing event but when I register a user, I get a “200” status “COMPLETE” but no contact is registered. If the contact does not exist, the contact is created, but not registered to the event.
I use the two endpoints:
• `<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/marketing-events/events>`
• `<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/marketing-events/attendance/{externalEventId}/{subscriberState}/email-create?externalAccountId={someId}>`
 Am I missing something? Worth noting is that I am doing this on a test account and I have not implemented the API on my application end described in the docs (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events#endpoint?spec=PATCH-/marketing/v3/marketing-events/events/{externalEventId}>) although it did not seem like a hard requirement.

Best regards,
Philip

Update: I was able to fix this by setting the `interactionDateTime` value to a valid dateTime. Since I received a 200 OK and a value of “0” was given in the docs, I incorrectly assumed that “0" was a valid value and represented “Date.now()” or similar.
Hi <#C2YHAHB6K|api> Do we have some way to log  `activity`  of any contact using python-sdk?
Hi, I have 4 apps in my account, do I need to migrate to private apps or it wont be affected by the change made by HubSpot?
nope there isn't any special treatment
What type of activity?
like an email or call?
No marketplace apps like you have aren't in anyway affected by the hapikey to private app transition
Only normal accounts are affected
Unfortunately no, it's really super hidden
glad you found the issue though, nice work!

No those apps aren't affected by the change, say for example though that you were using those apps for crm cards but your backend for those cards weren't using private apps (or app oauth) and instead using hapikeys then you would definitely need to change it
Sorry for dumb question, is there a definite way to check if it wont be affected or you can tell by just this screenshot?

the only thing affected by the hapikey transition are normal accounts (sandboxes and test ones as well, but they all fall under the umbrella of a normal account) these apps are built on a developer account
The only thing that would affect these is if you apps aren't using app oauth like they are meant for but instead are using hardcoded hapikeys
like a sent a message to whatsapp and then log it on activity
You mean this?
I believe we should be good then
<@U01QVR44MEY> thanks a lot

That client secret will help you get a token that you can use for oauth instead of a hapikey, and what you need to find out from your team that built the apps is: "do the apps use Oauth or are the hapikeys hardcoded"
Yeah you can use this endpoint for that: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/communications>

The problem is that this team doesnt exist anymore haha
Was trying to find a way to check that
oh that is unfortunate, yeah really if they knew what they were doing you should be fine

Indeed =/
One last question <@U01QVR44MEY>. it should be fine even tho they appear in my "normal" account?
yes the auth for marketplace apps hasn't changed at all
Thanks a lot
of course

Hi, I am new to this Slack, I hope I hit the right channel
I recently migrated my old api key to a private app but it seems I have trouble with some requests. For example when searching the CRM like in the first screenshot (using the old API key method), I got three results, which is fine. But when switching the private app method (using the Bearer token), I got only 1 result (second screenshot). Do you know why this happens? Thanks you for any help
Same thing, when trying to batch update contacts, it says the contact cannot be found

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Thank you for confirming that there is no special treatment with the domain setup. Have you ever encounter similar issue as we encounter? any idea why get signature can properly give correct signature on local machine (using ngrok), but not working on some domain assigned on vercel server (nextjs)?
I honestly haven't just like I mentioned above I got this scenario running fine on my end
I would try possibly trying different versions of the your signature by testings with all the domains, like just double check that HubSpot isn't using the old domain instead of the new one

Hi team, checking in. We’ve noticed a discrepancy with the V2 Blog API that has caused a production issue for our applications. *It appears that the `archived` field has been changed to `archived_at` unexpectedly; same for `deleted` changing to `deleted_at`.* Any thoughts on why this happened / why the documentation does not match either?

Hi Guys,
I’m doing some investigation into developing a public app using Nodejs. I’m wondering how the default deal properties work. Do I first need to get the `HubSpot_owner_id` through the owners endpoint by querying their email? Then create a deal, and then associate that deal with the default deal property? For example, I would like to update if a deal was won or lost. What’s the best way to accomplish that? Thanks.
Hey! Could anyone please give me one example of how can i associate one company with one file? So i can see it in "attachments"
I know how to do it in engagment api version 1, but i think i should do it in v3/v4

```# Starting November 30, 2022, API keys will be sunset as an authentication method. Learn more about this change: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-api-key-sunset> and how to migrate an API key integration: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app> to use a private app instead.
import requests

url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/communications//associations/>"

querystring = {"limit":"500","hapikey":"YOUR_HubSpot_API_KEY"}

headers = {'accept': 'application/json'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers, params=querystring)

print(response.text)```
from where I can get `YOUR_HubSpot_API_KEY`
If I enter my HS Key I get scope error
can anyone please help
thanks
Hi everyone! I have customer portal and contact list with access for this.  I want to display contact info on main domain (not customer portal). Is there any solution for my issue?
